meanings.sent1: The tiny kitten felt impuissant against the big dog.
meanings.sent2: The old man's impuissant grip couldn't open the jar.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's arch-nemesis had an impuissant plan to take over the city.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candle seemed impuissant compared to the blazing bonfire.
meanings.sent5: The wilting flower looked impuissant in the harsh sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The timid mouse felt impuissant in the presence of the prowling cat.
meanings.sent2: The paralyzed man was impuissant to stop the thief from escaping.
meanings.sent3: The detective's impuissant attempts to solve the case only led to dead ends.
meanings.sent4: The broken compass was impuissant in guiding the lost hikers.
meanings.sent5: The rusted key was impuissant in unlocking the ancient chest.

meanings.sent1: The sick child's impuissant cough worried the parents.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was impuissant against the raging river.
meanings.sent3: The impuissant light bulb flickered before finally going out.
meanings.sent4: The impuissant protest barely made a dent in the new law.
meanings.sent5: The impuissant breeze couldn't even rustle the leaves on the tree.
